derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'preparation for embalming, fragrant resinous substance'): from Old French basme, from Latin balsamum (see balsam)

entry.tran: （用于制作疗伤或镇痛油膏的）香树脂
entry.def: Balm is a sweet-smelling oil that is obtained from some tropical trees and used to make creams that heal wounds or reduce pain.
If you refer to something as balm, you mean that it makes you feel better.

example.ex: The place is balm to the soul.
example.tran: 这个地方能给灵魂带来慰藉。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various aromatic resinous substances used for healing and soothing
2. semisolid preparation (usually containing a medicine) applied externally as a remedy or for soothing an irritation
